title: Students experience agronomy through crop scouting competition

tasks.task: Participate in a hands-on agricultural competition at UK's Research and Education Center.
subtasks: Arrive at the research center on a cloudy morning.
Rotate through ten stations in the competition.
Learn about weeds identification, such as morning glories.
Scout fields for insects, diseases, and weeds.
Examine soil properties and address soil issues.
Study corn and soybean agronomy at younger growth stages.
Work with university faculty, graduate students, and interns.
Gain insight into future academic and career opportunities in agriculture.

tasks.task: Organize and manage a high school crop scouting competition.
subtasks: Coordinate eight high school teams, each consisting of four to six members.
Prepare and set up ten stations for the competition.
Guide students through the stations, focusing on various agricultural aspects.
Ensure smooth rotation between stations for all participating teams.
Evaluate the educational value and student engagement in the competition.
Promote the event as an annual opportunity for high school students interested in agriculture.

tasks.task: Attend a college field day or event on UK's Research and Education Center.
subtasks: Visit the center multiple times for field days and other events.
Explore the facilities, including demonstrations in soils, insects, and agronomy.
Participate in hands-on learning activities related to crop scouting and management.
Learn about local West Kentucky soil types and growing conditions.
Discuss career prospects in agriculture with university faculty and experts.
Network with agriculture professionals and university staff.
